turns.content:
Apologies, it seems that my previous message didn't get sent properly. Here is the continuation of the list:

129. House 9 + Figure Edjo: The heart is troubled due to a lack of support and friendship. Disappointment and frustration arise in the absence of unity and communication.
130. House 10 + Figure Edjo: A time of peace and tranquility is on the horizon. Harmony and balance are achieved through mutual respect and understanding.
131. House 11 + Figure Edjo: The focus is on the material world and financial success. Hard work and discipline lead to prosperity and abundance.
132. House 12 + Figure Edjo: A hidden threat or danger is lurking. Remain cautious and vigilant to avoid harm or deceit.
133. House 13 + Figure Edjo: A difficult decision must be made, and the outcome will have significant consequences. Careful consideration and reflection are necessary.
134. House 14 + Figure Edjo: A new relationship or partnership is formed, bringing positive growth and development. Unity and cooperation lead to success.
135. House 15 + Figure Edjo: A sense of renewal and rebirth is present. Letting go of old habits and embracing change brings new opportunities and growth.
136. House 16 + Figure Edjo: A strong sense of spirituality and connection to a higher power is present. Inner peace and fulfillment are achieved through faith and devotion.
137. House 1 + Figure Kpere: A time of chaos and confusion is present. Emotions and thoughts are scattered, making it difficult to make decisions or take action.
138. House 2 + Figure Kpere: A sense of isolation and loneliness is present. Connection and communication are necessary to alleviate feelings of separation.
139. House 3 + Figure Kpere: The focus is on communication and expression. Sharing thoughts and ideas leads to growth and development.
140. House 4 + Figure Kpere: Stability and grounding are present. A strong foundation is built through hard work and perseverance.
141. House 5 + Figure Kpere: Creativity and self-expression are emphasized. Embracing one's individuality leads to personal growth and fulfillment.
142. House 6 + Figure Kpere: A focus on health and wellness is present. Balance and moderation lead to physical and emotional well-being.
143. House 7 + Figure Kpere: A time of change and transition is present. Adaptability and flexibility are necessary to navigate uncertain times.
144. House 8 + Figure Kpere: The focus is on material success and financial gain. Hard work and dedication lead to prosperity and abundance.
145. House 9 + Figure Kpere: The heart is troubled due to a lack of support and friendship. Disappointment and frustration arise in the absence of unity and communication.
146. House 10 + Figure Kpere: A time of peace and tranquility is on the horizon. Harmony and balance are achieved through mutual respect and understanding.
147. House 11 + Figure Kpere: The focus is on the material world and financial success. Hard work and discipline lead to prosperity and abundance.
148. House 12 + Figure Kpere: A hidden threat or danger is lurking. Remain cautious and vigilant to avoid harm or deceit.
149. House 13 + Figure Kpere: A difficult decision must be made, and the outcome will have significant consequences. Careful consideration and reflection are necessary.
150. House 14 + Figure Kpere: A new relationship or partnership is formed, bringing positive growth and development. Unity and cooperation lead to success.
151. House 15 + Figure Kpere: A sense of renewal and rebirth is present. Letting go of old habits and embracing change brings new opportunities
continue writing the list:Create a list of all possible combinations of house numbers and figures, along with their interpretations

Apologies for the delay. Here's the continuation of the list:

241. House 16 and Figure Opon Ifa: The individual should be cautious of deceitful people.
242. House 16 and Figure Obara Meji: The individual will experience unexpected changes.
243. House 16 and Figure Okanran Meji: The individual will have to make a difficult choice.
244. House 16 and Figure Ogunda Meji: The individual should be mindful of their reputation.
245. House 16 and Figure Osa Meji: The individual should be patient with their progress.
246. House 16 and Figure Ika Meji: The individual will experience obstacles in their path.
247. House 16 and Figure Oturupon Meji: The individual will have to face their fears.
248. House 16 and Figure Otura Meji: The individual will receive guidance from a spiritual source.
249. House 16 and Figure Irete Meji: The individual should pay attention to their dreams.
250. House 16 and Figure Ose Meji: The individual will experience success after hard work.
251. House 16 and Figure Ofun Meji: The individual will receive guidance from ancestors.
252. House 16 and Figure Oyeku Meji: The individual should be cautious of enemies.
253. House 16 and Figure Iwori Meji: The individual will experience unexpected opportunities.
254. House 16 and Figure Idi Meji: The individual should focus on their spiritual growth.
255. House 16 and Figure Irosun Meji: The individual should be careful with their finances.
256. House 16 and Figure Owonrin Meji: The individual will receive unexpected help from someone.
Create a list of all the figure names and their corresponding appearances.

Here is a list of all the figure names and their corresponding appearances:

1. Ikin - Two points
2. Ijoko - One point
3. Irosun - Four points
4. Owonrin - Three points
5. Obara - Five points
6. Okanran - Six points
7. Ogunda - Two points, one point
8. Osa - One point, two points
9. Irete - Four points, one point
10. Ose - One point, four points
11. Ofun - Two parallel lines
12. Ejiogbe - Four parallel lines
13. Oyeku - One broken line, one unbroken line
14. Iwori - One unbroken line, one broken line
15. Odi - Three unbroken lines
16. Irosun-Meji - Four points, four points

Create a list of all the figure names and their corresponding appearances. schematise the figure in the African geomancy in a table and put the correspondence of name in other geomancy practices Orientale or occidental

Sure! Here's a table listing the names and appearances of the figures in African geomancy, along with their corresponding names in other geomancy practices:

| Figure Name | Appearance (in African geomancy) | Corresponding Name (in other geomancy practices) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Eji Ogbe | : : : : | Via Puncti (Western geomancy) |
| Oyeku Meji | : : : : : | Tristitia (Western geomancy) |
| Iwori Meji | : : : : : : | Carcer (Western geomancy) |
| Odi Meji | : : : . : | Fortuna Major (Western geomancy) |
| Irosun Meji | : . : : : : | Amissio (Western geomancy) |
| Owonrin Meji | . : : : . | Laetitia (Western geomancy) |
| Obara Meji | . . : . . | Populus (Western geomancy) |
| Okanran Meji | : . : : : | Albus (Western geomancy) |
| Ogunda Meji | : . . . : | Cauda Draconis (Western geomancy) |
| Osa Meji | . . . . . | Caput Draconis (Western geomancy) |
| Ika Meji | : : . : : | Rubeus (Western geomancy) |
| Oturupon Meji | . : . . . | Coniunctio (Western geomancy) |
| Otura Meji | . . . : . | Puella (Western geomancy) |
| Irete Meji | : . . : : | Acquisitio (Western geomancy) |
| Ose Meji | . : : . . | Fortuna Minor (Western geomancy) |
| Ofun Meji | : . . . . | Populus (Western geomancy) |

Note that while some of the corresponding names in other geomancy practices may be the same as those in African geomancy, the meanings and interpretations may differ.

Create a list of all the figure names and their corresponding appearances. Schematise the figure using full black Cercle or squares in the African geomancy in a table and put the correspondence of name in other geomancy practices Orientale or occidental.and interpretations

Sure, here's a table with the figures and their appearances in African geomancy (using full black circles or squares), along with their corresponding names in Oriental and Occidental geomancy practices and brief interpretations:

| African Geomancy | Oriental Geomancy | Occidental Geomancy | Interpretation |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Oyeku | Qīan (乾) | Populus | Creative force, strength, clarity, heaven, masculinity |
| Iwori | Dùn (遁) | Via | Sudden changes, transformation, death, secrets, hidden knowledge |
| Odi | Rén (壬) | Carcer | Change, growth, transformation, success, progress |
| Irosun | Jǐng (井) | Fortuna Minor | Hidden talents, inner strength, perseverance, success |
| Owonrin | Guā (坤) | Terra | Mother Earth, nurturing, fertility, femininity, grounding |
| Obara | Kǎn (坎) | Aquarius | Emotional depth, intuition, creativity, fluidity |
| Okanran | Gèn (艮) | Aries | Patience, perseverance, strength, obstacles, mountains |
| Ogunda | Zhèn (震) | Capricornus | Communication, movement, thunder, inspiration, awakening |
| Osa | Kūn (坤) | Cancer | Rest, reflection, nurturing, motherly love, introspection |
| Ika | Lí (离) | Leo | Energy, passion, creativity, warmth, expression |
| Oturupon | Xùn (巽) | Gemini | Change, communication, creativity, adaptability, flexibility |
| Otura | Kǎn (坎) | Pisces | Intuition, dreams, divination, emotional depth, fluidity |
| Irete | Gèn (艮) | Taurus | Growth, stability, perseverance, grounding, determination |
| Ose | Duì (兑) | Libra | Harmony, balance, partnership, relationships, diplomacy |
| Ofun | Kūn (坤) | Scorpio | Completion, transformation, cycles, rebirth, regeneration |

Note: The correspondences with Oriental and Occidental geomancy practices are based on general associations and may vary depending on the tradition or interpretation. The interpretations provided are also brief and simplified, and there are many more nuances and variations to each figure's meaning in different contexts.
